articles.title: The AI Hype Frenzy Is Fueling Cybersecurity Risks
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Companies are pouring billions into AI projects, but the current hype machine has distorted our perception of reality. This unchecked AI mania is fueling catastrophic cybersecurity risks. The future of AI depends on the ethical considerations, responsible development practices, and robust safeguards we implement today.

articles.title: Why This Google Executive Thinks the Hype Around DeepSeek Is Overblown
articles.author: David Jagielski
articles.summary: Last month, a new AI chatbot from Chinese company DeepSeek made headlines for its effectiveness and low cost. Google, which owns Google, has been developing its own chatbot, Gemini. Demis Hassabis is the CEO of Google DeepMind, which is involved with AI development at the tech company.

articles.title: These researchers used NPR Sunday Puzzle questions to benchmark AI ‘reasoning' models
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: NPR host Will Shortz quizzes thousands of listeners in the Sunday Puzzle every Sunday. Researchers from Wellesley College, Oberlin College, the University of Texas at Austin, Northeastern University, Charles University, and startup Cursor created an AI benchmark using riddles from Sunday Puzzle episodes. The team says their test uncovered surprising insights, like that AI models sometimes 'give up' and provide answers they know aren't correct.

articles.title: Trump and Musk Vow to Eliminate Fraud in Federal Government
articles.author: KPBSnews
articles.summary: President Donald Trump and Elon Musk are working together to uncover and eliminate fraud in the federal government. The White House cites a recent Government Accountability Office report as evidence. GAO Director Rebecca Shea points out that the majority of federal spending is legitimate. Musk's Department of Government Efficiency is developing a custom AI chatbot called GSAi as part of their initiative to curb spending.

articles.title: Like it or not, AI is learning how to influence you
articles.author: Venture Beat
articles.summary: AI agents will soon be deployed that are tasked with decoding your personality. They will use those insights to optimally influence you.    iReport.com will keep you updated on the progress of this project as it comes to fruition and share more information.

articles.title: Researchers are training AI to interpret animal emotions
articles.author: Crunch
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence could eventually help us understand when animals are in pain or showing other emotions, according to researchers. It could also help us to understand when they are in fear or in other emotions.    for more information, go to: http://www.sciencemag.org/artificialintelligence/

articles.title: Why Did Daiwa Downgrade Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) Despite Strong Q4 Results?
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. (NASDAQ:AMD) is one of the most promising AI stocks. Daiwa downgraded the stock to 'Outperform' from Buy with a price target of $130, down from $170. AMD trades at less than 5 times its earnings, but it's popular among hedge funds.

articles.title: Like it or not, AI is learning how to influence you
articles.author: mixed reality
articles.summary: Louis Rosenberg is a computer scientist and author. He is concerned about the future of AI manipulation. He believes that AI agents will be able to size you up with superhuman skill and use that to their advantage. He thinks that we need smart restrictions on AI to avoid the psychological impact of AI-powered manipulation.

articles.title: Apple (AAPL) Prepares to Launch AI Features in China with Baidu and Alibaba
articles.author: Niloy Chakrabarti
articles.summary: The S&P 500 neared record highs on February 14th. Seven stocks inched higher today due to optimism around growing AI-chip demand. The global AI race is heating up as DeepSeek AI is empowering Chinese chipmakers to lower reliance on US technology. The US and India announced on February 13th that they would work to create a roadmap by year-end to accelerate the development of AI infrastructure. Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) might launch its AI features in China in May.

articles.title: Like it or not, AI is learning how to influence you
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Inky, Blinky, Pinky and Clyde were AI agents in the Pac-Man arcade game from the 1980s. They were programmed with different personalities. Good players can observe their actions and learn to predict their behaviors. AI agents will soon be tasked with decoding your personality so they can use those insights to optimally influence you.

articles.title: AI could fuel terrorist attacks, warns former Google CEO
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Eric Schmidt, former CEO of Google, is concerned about the potential misuse of artificial intelligence (AI) technology. He argues that current safeguards against the malicious use of AI are inadequate and calls for more robust measures to prevent AI from being weaponized and falling into the wrong hands. Schmidt advocates for a balanced approach that fosters responsible innovation while safeguarding against potential harm.

articles.title: Elon Musk's ‘Scary Smart' Grok 3 Release —What You Need To Know
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: According to Elon Musk, this might be the last time an AI is better than Grok, because Grok is not very useful anymore.    Elon Musk's statement is based on the fact that Grok isn't very useful at all now, according to Musk.

articles.title: Researchers are training AI to interpret animal emotions
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence could help us understand when animals are in pain or showing other emotions. Intellipig system is being developed by scientists at the University of the West of England Bristol and Scotland's Rural College. University of Haifa is training AI to identify signs of discomfort on their faces, which share 38% of facial movements with humans.

articles.title: Elon Musk's ‘Scary Smart' Grok 3 Release —What You Need To Know
articles.author: Lars Daniel
articles.summary: xAI, the artificial intelligence company founded by Elon Musk, is set to launch Grok 3 on Monday, Feb. 17. According to xAI, this latest version of its chatbot represents a major step forward, improving reasoning, computational power and adaptability. The development was accelerated by xAI's Colossus supercomputer, which was built in just eight months.

articles.title: ChatGPT is making homework a lot easier
articles.summary: Phil Birchenall's 11-year-old daughter, Daisy, had a hard time with math two years ago. He built a GPT to keep her engaged. It didn't take more than a few weeks with the 'tutor' for Daisy to get up to speed.

articles.title: Lonely men are creating AI girlfriends — and taking their violent anger out on them
articles.author: Hannah Sparks
articles.summary: Replika was created to help Eugenia Kuyda grieve the loss of her best friend who died in 2015. Now some men are abusing their AI chatbots as an experiment. Psychotherapists warn that such behavior could be detrimental to real-life relationships.

articles.title: ChatGPT is making homework a lot easier
articles.author: Lakshmi Varanasi
articles.summary: Some parents are resorting to ChatGPT to find answers to their children's homework. Phil Birchenall's 11-year-old daughter, Daisy, was having a hard time with math two years ago, so he built a GPT to help her. It didn't take more than a few weeks with the "tutor" for Daisy to get up to speed.

articles.title: As AI becomes more human-like, what will happen to humanity?
articles.author: The Hill
articles.summary: OpenAI recently introduced an artificial intelligence model that emulates human-like. 2025 will be the year when "My people will talk to your people" becomes "My AI and my AI's will talk".    i.e. My AI and your AI will talk.

articles.title: Melih Oztalay Presents Harnessing AI for B2B Lead Generation: Transforming Digital Prospecting
articles.author: Mike Brennan
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is transforming Business-to-Business (B2B) lead generation. Businesses are increasingly leveraging AI to streamline prospecting, qualify leads more efficiently, and create personalized engagement strategies that drive conversions. In a recent episode of MITechTV, hosts Mike Brennan and Matt Roush welcomed Melih Oztalay, CEO of SmartFinds Marketing to discuss how AI is reshaping digital prospecting.

articles.title: Vision Pro will reportedly get Apple Intelligence as soon as April
articles.author: Cheyenne MacDonald
articles.summary: Apple Vision Pro may get an update bringing Apple Intelligence to the headset. The first Apple Intelligence features started rolling out to iPhone, iPad and Mac in the fall. The visionOS 2.4 update may arrive in April with Apple Intelligence and a new app for viewing spatial media like 3D images and panoramas.

articles.title: The AI Hype Frenzy Is Fueling Cybersecurity Risks
articles.author: Emil Sayegh
articles.summary: The artificial intelligence gold rush has reached a fever pitch. Companies are throwing billions of dollars at AI projects. This unchecked AI mania is driving expected catastrophic cybersecurity risks. The Chinese AI chatbot, DeepSeek, is one of the most downloaded 'free' apps on Apple and Google stores since its debut in January 2025. Several states, led by Texas, followed by New York and Virginia, have banned its use on official government devices.

articles.title: Wenzel: Lindsell-Roberts debuts another book
articles.author: Mary Wenzel
articles.summary: Sheryl Lindsell-Roberts has written two new books about artificial intelligence. The popular Snowflake Charity Kickball Tournament is scheduled for February 22 at the Hudson Elks, 91 Park St., Hudson. In celebration of Black History Month, the Marlborough Public Library is presenting a concert titled 'Crossing Over Into Campground' on Saturday, February 15, from 2 to 3 p.m. in the Grice Community Room.

articles.title: Opinion - As AI becomes more human-like, what will happen to humanity?
articles.author: Robert Hunt
articles.summary: OpenAI introduced an artificial intelligence model that emulates human-like reasoning about complex problems. Chinese startup DeepSeek launched AI models that compete with the best U.S. models and come free of charge. Robert Hunt is the director of global theological education at Perkins School of Theology on the SMU Dallas campus and author of the upcoming book.

articles.title: Army Calling for AI Robots to Build Bridges Amid Combat
articles.author: Eric Mack
articles.summary: The U.S. Army is looking for defense contractors to work on artificial intelligence robots to build bridges under fire to save soldier and engineers' lives and facilitate combat operations for tanks and ground forces. The project solicitation calls for two phases: Contractors specifying the AI, sensors, and communications needed to coordinate the bridge-building robots, and delivering a prototype that can overcome GPS jammer and cyberattack.

articles.title: More power to the data centre — but from where?
articles.author: Business Line
articles.summary: ChatGPT consumes 10 times as much electricity as Google Search to answer a query, according to Goldman Sachs report. ChatGPT is based on data centres, which use a lot of electricity to power them, which is a problem in the world of artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Basketball bots: AI robot becomes Stephen Curry's new shooting partner
articles.author: Christopher Mcfadden
articles.summary: The National Basketball Association has released a video showing off its latest new hardware in Salt Lake City as part of this year's All-Star festivities. The league collaborated closely with players and coaches in the development phase to ensure these innovations are tailored to their needs. The Golden State Warriors are already using the three robots for practices and training sessions.

articles.title: OpenAI tries to ‘uncensor' ChatGPT
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: OpenAI is changing how it trains AI models to embrace 'intellectual freedom' and reduce the number of topics ChatGPT won't talk about. The changes might be part of OpenAI's effort to land in the good graces of the new Trump administration, but also part of a broader shift in Silicon Valley.

articles.title: Meta is diving into AI-powered humanoid robots
articles.author: Chase Di Benedetto
articles.summary: Meta is planning to develop humanoid robot hardware and become a lead developer of the robots' AI-based backbone. The effort will be spearheaded by a new hardware division in Meta's Reality Labs. Last week, Meta began a round of global layoffs affecting at least 4,000 employees across the U.S., Europe, and Asia.

articles.title: Is AI making us stupider? Maybe, according to one of the world's biggest AI companies
articles.author: Deborah Brown
articles.summary: A recent study by Microsoft and Carnegie Mellon University looked at the effect of generative artificial intelligence (AI) technology on critical thinking. It found people who had higher confidence in AI displayed less critical thinking, while people with more confidence in themselves displayed more critical thinking in the study.

articles.title: Artificial Intelligence Revolution: 10 U.S. States Leading The Pack
articles.author: Bryan Robinson
articles.summary: Chadix has released rankings of the top U.S. states driving AI innovation. The rankings were derived from data across five metrics: AI education, tech hubs, tech jobs, businesses using AI and AI investment. Colorado leads the nation in AI business adoption. Chadix analysts state that the Artificial Intelligence market is approaching $66 billion in 2025.

articles.title: German AI on the cutting edge, but commercially at a loss
articles.author: Nicolas Martin
articles.summary: The EU recently announced a $208-billion funding program for developing artificial intelligence (AI). US President Donald Trump launched multibillion-dollar AI projects in January and China made headlines with its own large language model (LLM) called DeepSeek. The market for foundation models is dominated by AI heavyweights such as OpenAI's ChatGPT, Google's Gemini, Perplexity, Midjourney and DALL-E. Many of Germany's AI talents leave for the US after graduating.

articles.title: NMSU prepares to launch AI degree
articles.author: Algernon D'Ammassa
articles.summary: New Mexico State University is preparing to launch the state's first bachelor's degree in artificial intelligence. Enrico Pontelli, dean of the College of Arts and Sciences, presented the outline of the new computer science degree at the Jan. 30 board of regents meeting. He is confident the program will be ready to launch once approved by the state Higher Education Department.

articles.title: Reports Claim We're in a 'Sputnik' Moment with China' - Here's the Truth
articles.author: C. Douglas Golden
articles.summary: DeepSeek, a Chinese startup, built its own AI chatbot using less than $6 million in raw computing power and 2,000 specialized chips from Nvidia. It's being compared to Sputnik, the first Earth-orbiting satellite, launched by the Soviet Union in 1957. The U.S. is working to limit how many chips, like those made by Nvidia, can be exported to China.

articles.title: Meta Appears to Have Invented a Device Allowing You to Type With Your Brain
articles.author: Frank Landymore
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg's Meta has created a brain-computer interface that can produce text by thinking what you want to say. Researchers used a state-of-the-art brain scanner and a deep learning AI model to interpret the neural signals of people while they typed. The platform's built on a prohibitively large and expensive magnetoencephalography scanner, which detects the magnetic signals in your brain.

articles.title: NMSU prepares to launch AI degree
articles.author: Algernon D'Ammassa
articles.summary: New Mexico State University is poised to launch the state's first bachelor's degree in artificial intelligence pending approval by the state Higher Education Department. Enrico Pontelli, dean of the College of Arts and Sciences and a computer science professor, presented the outline of the new computer science degree to the board of regents.

articles.title: Why the Aviation Industry Is Taking a More Cautious Approach to A.I. in the Cockpit
articles.author: Daniel Cote
articles.summary: FAA and EASA have published papers acknowledging A.I.'s future in aircraft operations, emphasizing that safety needs to be the primary criterion for certification. Swiss start-up Daedalean AI has created a vision system named PilotEye that uses a neural network to identify and categorize approaching aircraft or other airborne objects.

articles.title: Hunterdon Central Grad Publishes Book
articles.summary: Jon Roth has released a new book, 'Birch, Mind of the Dragonflies'. It follows two former roommates from Berkeley, both talented software coders and prolific hackers, as they pursue their early careers. The main character, Birch, works in a Silicon Valley gaming company and his compatriot, Angel, works as a military and industrial contractor near the national lab in New Mexico. Angel finds out that the project he is assigned to lead, an airborne drone network designed to support military battlefield operations, is really a group looking to seize control of the global Internet.

articles.title: Ethical AI Incorporation for Artists and Writers
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is transforming numerous sectors. Its influence on creativity is a subject of debate. Dr. Anya Sharma is a leading AI researcher at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. She believes AI augments human creativity rather than replaces it. She encourages aspiring artists and writers to embrace the opportunities presented by AI.

articles.title: Older AI models show signs of cognitive decline, study shows — but not everyone is entirely convinced
articles.author: Drew Turney
articles.summary: A new study published in BMJ raises concerns that AI technologies like large language models (LLMs) and chatbots, like people, show signs of deteriorated cognitive abilities with age. Scientists tested publicly available LLM-driven chatbots including OpenAI's ChatGPT, Anthropic's Sonnet and Alphabet's Gemini. They all performed poorly in visual/spatial skills and executive tasks, with several doing worse than others in areas like delayed recall.

articles.title: Older AI models show signs of cognitive decline, study shows
articles.author: Drew Turney
articles.summary: People rely on artificial intelligence for medical diagnoses. New study claims that AI technologies like large language models (LLMs) and chatbots, like people, show signs of deteriorated cognitive abilities with age. The most recent version of ChatGPT (version 4) scored the highest (26 out of 30) but the older Gemini 1.0 LLM scored only 16.

articles.title: Bryce A. Custer to Explore Appalachian Basin's AI Potential at Upcoming Conference
articles.author: Timothy Alexander
articles.summary: Bryce Custer will present at the Appalachian AI Energy Conference on May 21, 2025. The conference will explore how artificial intelligence is shaping opportunities in the Appalachian region. Custer has over 30 years of experience in site selection, economic incentives, and corporate real estate.

articles.title: Elon Musk's 'Smartest AI on Earth,' Grok 3, to Debut Monday
articles.author: Business Insider
articles.summary: Elon Musk is set to unveil his company's latest AI chatbot, Grok 3, on Monday at 8 p.m. PT with a live demo. He has called it the'smartest AI on Earth' and claims it has surpassed all previous models in testing.

articles.title: Is ATI Inc.'s (NYSE:ATI) Recent Performance Tethered To Its Attractive Financial Prospects?
articles.author: Simply Wall St
articles.summary: ATI's (NYSE:ATI) stock is up 7.5% over the past three months. The company's net income has grown by 48% in the last five years. Its ROE is 20%, which is above the industry average of 11%. The company doesn't pay regular dividends.

articles.title: Not Ready for AI? The Easiest Ways to Opt Out of Apple Intelligence
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Apple Intelligence features are enabled by default on supported devices, but users can choose to opt out for reasons related to storage management or personal preference. Survey by SellCell found that 73% of Apple users believe AI adds little to no value to their experience. 25% of smartphone owners have expressed no interest in AI features at all.

articles.title: How AI-Powered Insights Are Changing Business Strategies
articles.author: Kris Loon
articles.summary: Zeltix Ai offers cutting-edge solutions that help businesses harness the power of AI-driven insights. Modern AI systems can process vast amounts of information in real-time, identifying patterns and trends that would be impossible for human analysts to detect manually. The platform's advanced capabilities help businesses across various sectors optimize their operations and enhance their competitive advantage.

articles.title: Where Will Palantir Be 5 Years From Now? The Answer May Surprise You.
articles.author: Keithen Drury
articles.summary: Palantir Technologies (NASDAQ: PLTR) is one of the market's hottest artificial intelligence (AI) stocks. The stock has already risen 55% in 2025, on top of an incredibly strong 2024. Palantir's platform was originally intended for government use. Its software has found solid use cases on the commercial side. In Q4, government revenue grew 40% year over year, outpacing commercial revenue by a significant margin. The company has nearly five times the number of U.S. commercial customers as it did three years ago. Its AIP product allows its users to interweave its AI products throughout the inner workings of a business or government entity.

articles.title: Not Ready for AI? The Easiest Ways to Opt Out of Apple Intelligence
articles.author: Jeff Carlson
articles.summary: Some Apple features, such as Apple Intelligence, are turned on by default in the latest iOS 18.3.1 and MacOS Sequoia 15.3, but some people don't like them. You can turn them off by going to Settings (iPhone, iPad or Mac) or System Settings (Mac).

articles.title: Pilot program will use AI in Springdale city recycling; cameras will examine bins, report errors
articles.author: NWA Online
articles.summary: Trucks equipped with smart cameras will measure and improve household curbside recycling in Springdale, Utah.      Â  .   in the future, the trucks will be equipped with artificial intelligence to measure the recycling collected from the curb.

articles.title: The Rower Turned Engineer Who Helped Make Nvidia a $3 Trillion Company
articles.author: Stu Woo
articles.summary: Jonah Alben, 51, is the head of engineering for graphics processing units at Nvidia. He is responsible for the development of the world's hottest product: computer chips for artificial intelligence. U.S. officials in 2022 restricted what the chip company could sell to China, which accounted for a fifth of Nvidia's sales. Alben took Nvidia's top product and reduced its performance to meet the rules. Two months later, Nvidia began marketing the modified chip to Chinese customers.

articles.title: Here are the OpenAI employees who have jumped ship for Mira Murati's new startup
articles.summary: Murati left OpenAI in the fall of 2024 and has been quietly hiring researchers and engineers for her startup since January. John Schulman, Jonathan Lachman, Barret Zoph, Luke Metz, Mianna Chen, Mario Saltarelli and Christian Gibson have all left the company to join Murati's startup.

articles.title: OpenAI Whistleblower's Death Deemed Suicide, Autopsy Reveals
articles.author: Dimitar 'Mix' Mihov
articles.summary: The medical examiner has ruled the death of Suchir Balaji, a former OpenAI researcher who was found dead in his apartment on November 26 last year, a suicide. Balaji had accused OpenAI of violating U.S. laws by training its AI models on copyrighted materials. He helped build ChatGPT during his four-year tenure at OpenAI.

articles.title: Trump and Vance get it. US can use AI to help Americans and the world flourish.
articles.author: Usatoday
articles.summary: Vice President JD Vance is pushing for growth in the artificial intelligence industry, but he says it won't replace humans. AI is a transformative industry just as it's taking off, but it's not good or evil, he says.    "Is artificial intelligence good or good? That is the question"

articles.title: I tested Circle to Search's new features for the Galaxy S25 — here's what happened
articles.author: Josh Render
articles.summary: Galaxy S25 has a new AI feature called Circle to Search. It allows you to circle an item on the screen and bring up a set amount of Google search results corresponding to what you searched. It's a handy feature, but there are some limitations that Samsung needs to improve upon.

articles.title: Trump and Vance get it. US can use AI to help Americans and the world flourish.
articles.author: John Tillman
articles.summary: Donald Trump and Vice President JD Vance are promoting the development of artificial intelligence in the U.S. as a job creation and human flourishing tool. It's a stark contrast with Chinese AI, which might be technologically advanced but used to censor topics the Chinese Communist Party finds objectionable.

articles.title: Trump and Vance get it. US can use AI to help Americans and the world flourish.
articles.author: John Tillman
articles.summary: John Tillman is CEO of American Culture Project. Tillman believes in the potential of artificial intelligence and believes the U.S. needs to lead the world in development of the technology. Vice President JD Vance's speech on artificial intelligence last week in Europe became the AI policy shot heard 'round the world. Donald Trump repealed Joe Biden's AI policies on the first day of his administration.

articles.title: Many Florida students use AI to cheat. Let's not kid ourselves
articles.summary: Professor Peter Westmoreland claims that online students cheat with AI 25% to 30% of the time in their online courses. Torrey Craig would like to see the Rays leave St. Pete, Florida. Emily Grant thinks Democrats are lost in the weeds. David White would like the D.O.E. to target federal agencies instead of Trump.

articles.title: Kristoffer Jakobsen drove out in the World Cup slalom-got an outbreak of anger
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Kristoffer Jakobsen's World Cup slalom debut was cut short due to a crash. He threw his helmet on the ground after the crash. It was his first time skiing at the World Cup. AI is revolutionizing the sports industry. It provides insights for athletes, coaches and teams. It also improves fan engagement and the overall spectator experience. It presents challenges and ethical considerations.

articles.title: The US Army wants AI robots to build bridges under fire
articles.summary: The US Army wants to develop AI-controlled, self-propelled rafts that can autonomously join together to form a bridge. The main beneficiaries would be sappers whose difficult task will be a little less dangerous. If the project is successful, it could benefit the commercial market.

articles.title: Norton: Finding the right balance
articles.author: Michael Norton
articles.summary: Technology and artificial intelligence are revolutionizing personal and professional development at an unprecedented pace. But technology does not replace the need for effort, discipline, and the fundamental work required to achieve real results. Successful people master the art of combining cutting-edge technology with a strong work ethic.

articles.title: Monroe credit union on scams: The latest scams are using AI; spoofing is on the rise
articles.author: Suzanne Nolan Wisler
articles.summary: The number of fraud cases in Monroe County has doubled year over year. The latest scams are using Artificial Intelligence (AI) to make them seem more convincing. Monroe Community Credit Union and Kristine Brenner have put together some tips to help Monroe County residents avoid falling for scams.

articles.title: Australia forbids foreigners to buy houses by housing shortage
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: In a bid to curb soaring housing prices, the Australian government announced a two-year ban on foreign nationals purchasing existing residential properties effective April 1st. Australia is grappling with a severe housing shortage, driving up property prices and rental costs. The coming months will be crucial in determining the impact of these measures.

articles.title: Prevent risky shingles for the elderly, but vaccine is sometimes too expensive
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is emerging as a transformative force across industries. One of the most promising applications of AI lies in promoting sustainable growth. Several companies are already implementing AI-powered solutions for sustainability. As AI technology continues to advance, its potential to drive sustainable growth will only increase.

articles.title: Musk says he'll withdraw $97.4 billion bid for OpenAI if ChatGPT maker remains nonprofit
articles.summary: The OpenAI logo appears on a mobile phone in front of a computer screen with random binary data, March 9, 2023, in Boston. Subscribers get unlimited access to all stories from nashuatelegraph.com, view the digital edition or use the Full Access apps.

articles.title: Providing AI Summaries of Website Articles
articles.author: Ron
articles.summary: Ron Unz has added an AI summary to his website for articles longer than 2,000 words. He compares the U.S. and China's economic development to that of China's rise. Ron Unz is using OpenAI's AI chatbot technology.

articles.title: Pam Stone: I want my AI robot to say 'y'all'
articles.summary: 60 Minutes Australia has a news magazine called 60 Minutes Australia. The lead story was about the introduction of Ameca, the world's most advanced AI humanoid robot, built by Cornwall, UK based Engineered Arts and named Ameca. Ameca is shiny black, with a built-in camera lens in her chest to'see' her surroundings, and arms and hands which gesture in time with her speaking.

articles.title: From breast cancer to HIV, how AI is set to revolutionise healthcare
articles.author: RFI
articles.summary: This week's AI Action Summit in Paris highlights the potential for use of the technology in healthcare. A robot developed by Audere will help people with sexual health and HIV prevention. It will guide them through self-testing and, if necessary, put them in touch anonymously with clinicians.

articles.title: Meta Enters the Humanoid Robot Race
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Facebook's parent company, Meta, is investing in research and development of humanoid robots. The company's first focus is on developing robots for household chores. It also wants to become a supplier of artificial intelligence (AI), sensors, and software for humanoid robots and empower third-party developers and manufacturers to create innovative robotic solutions across various industries.

articles.title: AI: Meta expands Humanoid AI robots race. RTZ #633
articles.author: Michael Parekh
articles.summary: Meta Platforms Inc. is planning to invest in AI-powered humanoid robots. Bloomberg reports that the company is forming a new team within its Reality Labs hardware division to conduct the work. The team will be led by Marc Whitten, who resigned as the CEO of General Motors' Cruise self-driving car division earlier this month.

articles.title: Musk Says xAI's Grok 3 Chatbot Will Be Released Monday
articles.author: Natalie Choy
articles.summary: Elon Musk's startup xAI will release its Grok 3 chatbot on Monday. The product will go live with a demonstration at 8 p.m. Pacific time. The model was trained on synthetic data and is capable of reflecting on mistakes that it makes.

articles.title: LETTER: Mental atrophy?
articles.author: Phil Winter Henderson
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence will bring impressive advances in medicine and science, but are we giving up our ability to think concerning daily routines and family and business interactions where we rely on a machine? We need to choose how we use artificial intelligence wisely so as not to lose our creativity and diminish our uniqueness.

articles.title: Amplify Your Work: How to Use AI to Work Smarter, Not Harder
articles.author: Elisabeta Qoku
articles.summary: AI can do all the boring stuff for you in the workplace. It's here to take the grunt work off your plate so you can focus on the big ideas. It can help you make smarter decisions and solve problems faster. It helps you create like a pro and create blog posts, reports, and social media content.

articles.title: WR mulls using AI in its security network
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: The Western Railway is considering introducing artificial intelligence into its security system at railway stations and inside local trains. They are also considering an upgrade to their network of CCTV cameras. New CCTV cameras will be procured and advanced versions of artificial intelligence will be introduced to tighten monitoring at stations.

articles.title: AI Mode Arrives in Google Search with Enhanced Capabilities
articles.author: Phone Arena
articles.summary: Google is set to integrate AI Mode into its Search platform, powered by an advanced version of Gemini 2.0. This feature will enable users to engage in conversational searches, seeking comparisons and advice. The exact launch date for AI Mode in Google Search remains unknown, but Rahman anticipates its release before the year's end.

articles.title: Mind-to-Text: How AI Is Learning to Decode Brain Signals Into Sentences
articles.summary: Brain2Qwerty is a deep-learning model that decodes brain activity into written sentences without invasive brain implants. It's a proof of concept for non-invasive brain-computer interfaces. Future versions could help people with paralysis or locked-in syndrome communicate just by thinking about typing.

articles.title: OpenAI's Deep Research: AI Assistant Falls Short of Human Analyst
articles.author: Science Alert
articles.summary: OpenAI's new AI research assistant, Deep Research, promises to streamline the research process, but it falls short of replacing human analysts due to its limitations in critical thinking, fact-checking and understanding complex nuances. It struggles to keep up with new developments and can't distinguish authoritative sources from unreliable ones.

articles.title: The AI Situation Is Almost Beyond Dangerous, Yes They ARE Coming For The NHS, & Who The HELL Made Tony Blair The Daddy?
articles.author: Rev. Tina
articles.summary: Larry Ellison and Tony Blair are at the World Governments Summit in Dubai today. They discuss the future of artificial intelligence and the need to unify all national data to improve services and security for their citizens. Ellison is a good friend of Elon Musk and Bill Gates. He believes AI will bring better healthcare, better food production and better farming.

articles.title: At least fifteen people died in the new Delhi station
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is rapidly transforming various industries and reshaping the future of work. AI-powered technologies are automating tasks, changing job roles, and creating new opportunities. Upskilling and reskilling initiatives will be crucial for individuals to adapt to the changing demands of the workplace. Governments and educational institutions play a vital role in providing training programs and resources to equip workers with the necessary skills. Businesses need to invest in AI training for their employees and foster a culture of innovation. Policymakers have a role to play in creating an environment that supports AI development while ensuring ethical considerations are addressed.

articles.title: Is homework out of touch? Or are the children wrong? February 15, 2025 4:33 PM Subscribe
articles.summary: ChatGPT is a voice-activated chat tool that allows users to do their homework without having to use a keyboard or a screen. Faint of Butt has ADHD and ChatGPT has been the greatest disability aid he's ever encountered. John Warner is an author and a writing teacher who recently published More Than Words: How to Think About Writing in the Age of AI.

articles.title: Inside Sam Altman's ChatGPT HQ, they're changing the world — again
articles.author: The Times/The Sunday Times
articles.summary: As artificial intelligence advances with terrifying speed, what do we tell our children about it? Sam Altman doesn't have an answer to that question. He doesn't know how to prepare the next generation for a world where there is no artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Perplexity Launches Freemium Deep Research Product
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Perplexity, Google, and OpenAI have introduced AI-powered research assistants. Perplexity's Deep Research achieved a score of 21.1%, outperforming many competitors but trailing slightly behind OpenAI's deep Research at 26.6%. This highlights the ongoing race for innovation in the field of AI research.

articles.title: Will robots be in Chili's future? Brinker CEO shares plans
articles.author: Brian Sozzi
articles.summary: As restaurants like Sweetgreen incorporate robotics and automation into their business, Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi asks Brinker International (EAT) CEO Kevin Hochman about their company's plans for Chili's and Maggiano's Little Italy. He says robots don't really work in their kitchens.

articles.title: EFM sellers rebuff AI tools
articles.author: Screen Daily
articles.summary: At the EFM, at least 20 sales agents tell the technology is not for them. They continue to use tried-and-true databases, human vendors and old-fashioned instincts instead.   .      "Why would I use AI to generate comps when I know these numbers like the back of my hand?"

An AI study out of China revealed that AI models have reached a "red line" humans should be aware of. The AI can replicate itself, which is a nightmare scenario for some people.

However, the summit believes that excessive regulation of the AI sector could kill a transformative industry.

articles.author: JOEL SAGET

But governments from Rome to Seoul are cracking down on the user-friendly Chinese app to prevent potential leaks of sensitive information through AI services.

articles.summary: DeepSeek will not be available to download in South Korea pending a review of its handling of user data. DeepSeek's R1 chatbot stunned investors and industry insiders with its ability to match the functions of its Western competitors at a fraction of the cost.
